content.title: Atal Amrit Abhiyan Scheme
content.beneficiary: Below Poverty Line (BPL) population and Low-Income households
content.details: The scheme 'Atal Amrit Abhiyan Scheme' is a flagship scheme of the Government of Assam to provide cashless treatment and coverage of critical care targeted at the Below Poverty Line (BPL) population and Low-Income households. To address this key vulnerability faced by the BPL population and Low-Income households in the State, the Government of Assam has launched the health assurance scheme 'Atal Amrit Abhiyan Scheme' which aims at making treatment more affordable and also to limit the disastrous financial impact that households often experience due to out of pocket spending. Under this scheme, treatment benefits up to ₹2.00 lakhs per individual annually towards approved procedures on a complete cashless basis is given. Beneficiaries can avail of cashless treatment under the scheme in the empanelled Government/Private Hospitals in six critical care specialities.
benefits: The scheme will provide inpatient treatment facilities at the empanelled hospitals (Private and Public) up to a maximum limit of ₹2.00 lakh per individual member per annum within and outside the State of Assam covering 438 procedures.
The six diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, Cancer, Renal (Kidney) diseases, Neo-natal diseases, Neurological conditions & Burns will be covered under the scheme.
Cashless treatment and coverage of critical care targeted at the Below Poverty Line (BPL) population and Low-Income households.
The enrolled beneficiary is to be treated or can be admitted without making any payment to the hospital.
There will be no pre-existing condition exclusions. Pre-existing diseases are also covered from day one.
The travel expenses of visiting people, treatment, and the daily allowance are also covered in this scheme.
For out of State treatment in empanelled hospitals in selected cities, patients and one attendant will be provided economy cheapest airfare on that route.
eligibility: The individual should be a permanent resident of Assam.
All individuals from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families (up to an annual income of ₹ 1.2 lakhs) are eligible to enroll and avail of the benefits under this Scheme.
All families (with annual income between ₹1.2 and ₹5 lakhs) are also eligible to enroll and avail of the benefits under this Scheme.
The individual should possess a ration card issued by the Government of Assam under the National Food Security Act.
content.application_process: Beneficiaries must fill out the application form completely and visit the nearest enrolment center. All beneficiaries must be physically present at the enrollment center. The Verifying Officer scrutinizes all documents and verifies eligibility. After verification, the operator issues the unique Atal Amrit Abhiyan Card (AAA ID card) along with the scheme hand-out to beneficiaries.
documents_required: Attested copy of the Voter ID card
Photograph of the Patient (Attested by Doctor)
For every BPL family member, National Food Security Act (NFSA) card
For every other family member, an income certificate from the Circle officer signifying annual family income as less than ₹5.00 Lakhs.
Birth certificate for a minor member of the family

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide cashless treatment and coverage of critical care targeted at the Below Poverty Line (BPL) population and Low-Income households.

faqs.question: How much amount of treatment will be covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, treatment benefits up to ₹2.00 lakhs per individual member per annum within and outside the State of Assam covering.

faqs.question: Can an individual avail the benefits of the scheme also in a private hospital?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary can avail of cashless treatment under the scheme in the empanelled Government as well as Private Hospitals.

faqs.question: What are the six critical care specialities covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The six specialities are- cardiovascular diseases, Cancer, Renal (Kidney) diseases, Neo-natal diseases, Neurological conditions & Burns.

faqs.question: Can an enrolled beneficiary be treated or admitted without making any payment to the hospital under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the enrolled beneficiary is to be treated or can be admitted without making any payment to the hospital.

faqs.question: Are pre-existing diseases also covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, Pre-existing diseases are also covered from day one.

faqs.question: Is this scheme also covering travel expense?
faqs.answer: Yes, the travel expenses of visiting people, treatment, and the daily allowance are also covered in this scheme.

faqs.question: Will this scheme cover the travel expense out of the state of Assam?
faqs.answer: For out of State treatment in empanelled hospitals in selected cities, patients and one attendant will be provided economy cheapest airfare on that route.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the resident of Assam?
faqs.answer: Yes, the individual should be a permanent resident of Assam.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: All individuals from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families whose annual family income is upto ₹ 1.2 lakhs and all other families whose annual income is between ₹1.2 and ₹5 lakhs are also eligible to enroll and avail of the benefits under this Scheme.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to have a ration card while applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the individual should possess a ration card issued by the Government of Assam under the National Food Security Act.

faqs.question: What is the enrolment fee for a member of the BPL families?
faqs.answer: Enrollment under the scheme is totally free for members of the BPL families.

faqs.question: What is the enrolment fee for a member of the families other than BPL families?
faqs.answer: Members of other families having an annual family income of ₹5 lakhs or less are required to pay a nominal amount of ₹ 100/- per individual at the time of enrolment.

faqs.question: How can I enrol under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The individual after filling out the application form completely can visit the nearest enrolment center.
